abstract_summ: Conclusions The present study demonstrates the impact of COVID-19 on North American cardiac surgery institutions as well as help associate region and COVID-19 burden with the impact on cardiac surgery volumes and case mix.Background The COVID-19 pandemic has dramatically reduced adult cardiac surgery case volumes as institutions and surgeons curtail non-urgent operations.We estimated the number of cancelled surgical procedures in the National Health Service (NHS) in England due to COVID-19 and how this deficit would change over time once elective surgery was reintroduced.Results Cardiac surgery volumes fell to 54% of baseline after restrictions were implemented.Summary The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic has had a massive impact on waits for elective operations, with tens of thousands of scheduled surgeries being cancelled or postponed across Canada.
